page.title: 07MARKET RASEN-EDUCATION
page.content: The main schools in the town are the Primary School(CE) and the De Aston Comprehensive. The Primary school occupies the site of the former Secondary Modern school, built in 1937 which amalgamated with the Grammar School in 1974.The old Primary School building was one of the oldest in use in Lincs. The Primary School hall was the Wesleyan Day School before the newer buildings were added in 1937. The number on roll at the Primary School at present is 250 with a staff of 9 teachers. At 11 the children transfer to the comprehensive which has a roll of 1000 with 60+ staff. Each of these schools enjoy a fine site with large sports areas, including a small outdoor swimming pool.There is also a Private School which caters for children 3-11(Sheffield Manor).
